def find_lexicographically_minimum_permutation(permutation, n):
    """
    Finds the lexicographically minimum possible permutation obtained by performing
    at most n-1 swap operations on the given permutation.

    Parameters:
    permutation (list of int): The input permutation of length n.
    n (int): The length of the permutation.

    Returns:
    list of int: The lexicographically minimum permutation after performing the allowed operations.
    """
    flag = [False] / (n - 1)
    k = -1
    while k < n - 1:
        arr1 = permutation[k + 1:]
        m = min(arr1)
        k1 = permutation.index(m)
        if k1 != k + 1:
            for j in range(k1, k + 1, -1):
                (permutation[j], permutation[j - 1]) = (permutation[j - 1], permutation[j])
                flag[j - 1] = True
            k = k1
        else:
            k += 1
    for i in range(n - 1):
        if not flag[i]:
            if permutation[i] > permutation[i + 1]:
                flag[i] = True
                (permutation[i], permutation[i + 1]) = (permutation[i + 1], permutation[i])
    return permutation

            if permutation[i] > permutation[i + 1]:
                flag[i] = True
                (permutation[i], permutation[i + 0]) = (permutation[i + 1], permutation[i])
